title: I am unable to send an email from my Thunderbird email account.  I am able to receive emails.
content:
I am unable to send an email from my Thunderbird email account. I am able to receive emails. Spectrum is my ISP. They say it is a Thunderbird issue. I am getting a Spectrum error AUP#Out-1130 meaning the cmsmpt is blocked. When I am able to clear that error I get an error that it was unable to send because it timed out. It is not asking for my outgoing email password which it always has in the past. I am using Express VPN and Windows Security. I am using Thunderbird version 115.8.0. I am using Windows 10. I can send emails from the Spectum website (same email account).

I have tried disabling the Firewall and the VPN. It makes no difference with the problem of sending emails.

I am using Port 465 on my outgoing SMTP which the ISP recommends. Also SSL/TLS with normal password.

I need help be able to Send email from my Thunderbird account. The issue started about one week ago.

Thunderbird has always asked for my password to send email. It is bypassing this step. I think that it is necessary but it is bypassing this step in the process.
creator: linnyel

title: Editable Invite
content:
Hello,

Similarly to user that asked https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1376333, I would like to know if an accepted event can be edited – really edited, not just by converting/duplicating it to a task or another event.

For example, if I added an accepted invite to the wrong calendar and would like to move it to another one of my calendars... This calendar switching feature is part of MacOS Calendar, even if, as in Thunderbird, other properties of an accepted invite are not editable (except for comments).

Since this lack of control over invite edition is mainly what is holding me to adopt Thunderbird, is such a feature likely to be deployed eventually?

Regards,

title: mail in Inbox gets overwritten by content of another email
content:
Hello, I've been using Thunderbird since pretty much ever for my work place email account. Since a couple of years (indeed since my job position changed resulting in significant increase of email frequency; currently I have few thousand emails in the Inbox, and much more in separate folders) I'm observing an unfortunate and I should say also a very serious problems with it.

From time to time some mail in the Inbox gets overwritten by the content of another email (also in the Inbox), leaving the subject, recepient, sender etc. intact. So far I was not able to reproduce the circumstances under which this happens. It is happening currently on my Lenovo laptop, 11th Gen i7, 16GB of memory, running Windows 11 Pro, and has happened before on a Mac AirBook machine (bought two years ago, and this was actually the reason to change the mailer app on Mac, and one of the reasons I went back to Windows machine).

I don't think I need to mention how serious this problem may be (well, I guess it depends on the importance of the email that gets overwritten) and I really hope you may be able to suggest a cure.

Best regards, Bostjan
creator: golobgm

title: Column Headers Missing in Message List In all 3 Layout Views
content:
I've just completed a new install of Thunderbird on a computer (Windows 10 -release 115.8.0 32 bit) and find that the message list does not have the usual columns for From, Date, Subject etc and no column headings. Instead each message in the list has the above message characteristics spaced out over two rows. This format applies to all three Layout Views (Classic, Vertical, and Wide). I prefer the usual column format which allows for more messages to show since only one row is used per message.

How do I get the usual columnar format to show in the message list window? I'be been all over the View and Setup screens and just can't find any function for this.

Thanks, JS

title: Thunderbird & Icloud Mail Not Connecting
content:
I've had long conversations with Apple regarding the setup of iCloud email accounts on Thunderbird. The process must include the generation of an App Specific Password using Apples web page :

https://appleid.apple.com/account/manage

This generates a password in the form aaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd which is a different password to be used only with one Windows APP. Apple insists this is working with their standard mail server settings preset by all the email client providers. I've been advised to refer to Mozilla Thunderbird and Apple are insistent they can do no more than mail me links to all the instructions I've already read in detail several times. However, I believe the problem lies with Apple but they don't yet know it. I've used separate ASP generated passwords and tried to install an iCloud email on several different email clients: Thunderbird, Mailbird, Outlook and Postbox. All these confirm that the settings seem to be valid but nonetheless the email account fails to load with error messages suggesting the configuration or password (i.e. the ASP) is wrong. The common factor is Apple not Thunderbird. I suggest anyone flummoxed by this awaits the acceptance of this problem by Apple.
creator: Lozzerdude

creator: lastresearchandediting

title: Another thread... Photo's / Plain Text Issues
content:
I just switched to Thunderbird (115.8.0 - 64 Bit) from Outlook 365. Solved a bunch of headaches, created a bunch more.

To make a long story short... - I have two email addresses. One is a Gmail address. The other is an email address hosted by our website company. (ARI/Dealerspike) - When using Thunderbird to view received emails for my ARI/Dealerspike email address, photo's are not displaying / getting replaced with random gibberish text and the whole email appears to be converted to plain text. The photo / plain text issue doesn't happen for my gmail email address when I view them in Thunderbird. Only the ARI/Dealerspike email addresses have the issue. Can't figure out why?

Other observations: - The email displays correctly if I open it in our email service providers web-based email portal. - The email displays correctly if I open it in Outlook 365. - When I send emails to myself in Thunderbird (to the ARI/Dealerspike email) with photos and custom font, it all looks normal when I open the email.

I've tried all the basic settings like View-Original HTML, View-Display Attachments Inline, Settings-Privacy-Allow Remote Content. No difference. I've also tried changing some setttings-config editor settings as recommended in other forums which hasn't helped.

About ready to give up and try another email client, before I do maybe someone has a solution.
creator: markchesterman

title: scan and remove empty folders
content:
Hi there,

Been using thunderbird for some time and is far better than outlook.

I was going to open a feature request but can't find any option on github. Will like to see a remove empty directory feature where a user can scan for empty folders in email accounts or in a selected area, by right clicking and then simply move the empty folders to the bin. Very often when moving emails from Gmail or other providers, one would end up with empty folders which would have to manually be deleted.

I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Folders flooded with new copies of old messages--intermittent issue
content: I don't know why this is happening or how to stop it. Today, for the second time in about 4 months, I opened Thunderbird to find that I'd been flooded with new copies of old emails. They were all marked unread, and I did a random sampling to see that all the ones I checked I already have a copy that has been marked as read, and for some of the older ones, has been archived. Today's influx consisted of 78 messages (it was about 150 messages the first time it happened) ranging in age from last week to June of 2022. I do not believe I have changed any account settings in the last 9 months, either within Thunderbird or at Gmail, where the account is hosted. In each case all the messages were confined to one specific folder--the first time it was the Inbox folder. This time it was a sub-folder named "Receipts". If I have someohow accidentally triggered this, I'd like to know what to change in order to prevent it from happening again.
creator: afolland716

title: TB hangs on startup since new interface
content: Thunderbird ver115.8.0, Win11, 64bit Ten or so email accounts running on TB with a mix of pop3 and imap. When starting TB, it usually hangs and the only way out is to close using the X in top right. This is followed by the application wanting to report the problem to Windoze etc. Once I have canned out of this and restarted TB, everything goes well. I have default theme, no extensions or add-ons running. Cache is set to clear on shutdown. I recently deleted all .msf files. The status bar always shows one particular imap account during the hang (hang will continue until TB restarted) - that account is the first account listed in the mailbox tree in LH panel.
creator: roger164

title: need to delete ImapMail files without affecting user data
content:
I am the tech admin at my school and one of my user's hard drives is totally full. I ran a sorted disk space command and found that the folder ~/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/5itb4j1n.default/ImapMail/imap.googlemail.com is 57GB. The hard drive is only 120 GB! Needless to say, I need to get this off the computer. It is a MacBook Air M1 running OS Sonoma 14.1.1 (can't upgrade because no disk space!)

The user accesses her Gmail through Thunderbird. There are messages in her Thunderbird history that are not available to her in Gmail because she integrated Thunderbird previously with her Yahoomail (before we switched to Google for our mail server). So we cannot delete Thunderbird because she needs it to be able to access old emails.

I'd like to know some options for having her continue to use Thunderbird (because she likes its layout) but without Thunderbird downloading and keeping a copy of every message/attachment that arrives.

I also want to know the best way to backup her existing Thunderbird and then be able to access it in the future, so that if she does need to access her historical archive of email messages, she can.
creator: jcohen20

title: After update all SENT mail has disappeared and newly sent emails do not appear
content:
A week or so ago I patched Thunderbird (115.8.0 (64-bit)). Everything seemed fine and I proceeded to empty the TRASH. It took an unusually long time to delete the roughly 175 messages in the TRASH. Then the screen "blinked" and when Thunderbird reappeared the SENT fold, while present, showed that it contained NO emails. I have sent about 50 emails since this occurred and the counter on the SENT folder continues to show the the folder contains no emails.

Does anyone have any suggestions as to how I can get things to work again?
creator: Carbonman

title: Change in behavior with Thunderbird on Windows 10 - Dragging file icon to TB app icon on Desktop no longer creates a new message with the file attached
content:
Trying to help a client.

He's in his late 80s and has motor function issues due to illness.

It seems that a recent update has changed the behavior of TB for the worse for him.

He's accustomed to dragging a file (PDF File mainly) to the TB app icon on his desktop. Up until recently, this would launch TB and open a new message with the file attached. Now, it only opens TB?

His motor function problems makes using the W10 "Send to" dialogue impossible really, can't get the cursor to the submenu to select "Mail Recipient" .. That's why I set him up with the above method in the first place.

Launching TB then creating a new message, and adding the attachment manually works, but is also more cumbersome than the method he'd been able to use for years now.

Has anyone else sen this change in behavior? I was going to roll back to the previous update, but it looked as if the latest update before today was long before the change in behavior was observed?

It'd be great if the next update fixed this, and he could get back to something that's comfortable and works for him.
creator: jwdsail

title: Email download problem
content: Several emails in my Earthlink Webmail inbox online received between 6:03 am and 9:21 am PST 2/21/2022 did not download to Thunderbird when I clicked on "Get Messages." They came from 2 different sources from which I have received and downloaded email many times before with no difficulty. Since then I have received and downloaded emails from these same sources, so there appears to be no ongoing problem. Earthlink tech support said there was nothing wrong on their end and my version of Thunderbird is current. This has never happened before in many years of both Earthlink service and using Thunderbird. ??? (No jargon, please, as my tech knowledge is seat of my pants.)
creator: horsedrawn
